Authors: Bo Wang, Yun Yu, Long Wang
Title:
Penicillium fusisporum and P. zhuangii, two new
monoverticillate species with apical-swelling stipes of section
Aspergilloides isolated from plant leaves in China
Abstract:
Two new Penicillium species isolated from plant leaves are
reported here, namely, P. fusisporum (type strain AS3.15338T = NRRL
62805T = CBS 137463T) and P. zhuangii (type strain AS3.15341T = NRRL
62806T = CBS 137464T). P. fusisporum is characterized by fast growth
rate, apical-swelling monoverticillate penicilli, verrucose stipes,
fusiform to oblong conidia about 3.5â“4Ã2â“2.5 mm and cinnamon-colored
sclerotia. While P. zhuangii presents a moderate growth rate, it also
bears apical-swelling monoverticillate penicilli but its stipes are
smooth-walled, and produces ovoid to globose smooth-walled conidia about
3â“3.5 mm. Both species belong to section Aspergilloides, and P.
fusisporum is related to ââP. thomii var. flavescensââ, while P.
zhuangii is morphologically similar to P. lividum. Phylogenetic analyses
of sequences of calmodulin and beta-tubulin genes both show that the two
new taxa form distinct monophyletic clades.
